intro: Halenia barbicaulis, commonly known as the feather-stemmed halenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly waxy texture. Halenia barbicaulis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
